title: Genderbent Ekko Cosplay

embed.description: EFG. 49 likes. Design, photography, and a little bit of cosplay!

body:
This past weekend I cosplayed a genderbent Ekko at San Japan in San Antonio, Tx. I'd love to get some feedback on how I could improve it (asides from the gloves and hair).
Although I wasn't too pleased by my hair color, I was going for a style like in the first photo (I despise wigs.)
No gloves because of time constraints.

Out of everything the props are my favorite. I decided to add led lights thanks to inspiration from [Kadu Out Cosplay](https://www.facebook.com/Kaduout).

Credit to [Kiyouko](http://kiyouko.deviantart.com/) for the artwork.

{{champion:245}}

replies.body:
Man, the Doctor would have been _very_ displeased with Ekko's time-manipulating shenanigans.  If the vortex manipulator offended him, the Zero Drive would send him up the wall!

(Excellent job on that Zero Drive though - the glowing is particularly well done.)

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=JH39mY0Z,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-08-04T01:33:34.742+0000)
>
> Man, the Doctor would have been _very_ displeased with Ekko's time-manipulating shenanigans.  If the vortex manipulator offended him, the Zero Drive would send him up the wall!
> 
> (Excellent job on that Zero Drive though - the glowing is particularly well done.)

Haha, I would love to see the Doctor and Ekko meet! Doctor would more than likely dislike the Z-Drive more than a Vortex Manipulator.

Thank you! I'm glad I have been getting positive responses, especially since this was a last minute project.
Oh, I want to see that episode now. :P Maybe not with Capaldi, though. He's a little grumpy at the best of times, I feel like he would just take it or something.
Oh, that's cool. Those glowy Z-Drive and clock things are awesome. What did you do for them? Translucent plastic with lights in them or something else?

> [{quoted}](name=kayakninja,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=JH39mY0Z,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-08-04T06:34:35.544+0000)
>
> Oh, that's cool. Those glowy Z-Drive and clock things are awesome. What did you do for them? Translucent plastic with lights in them or something else?

Yes, all the lit areas are made of plastic/acrylic that have been covered with a glass frosting spray .

Feel free to message me on my design page, [EFG](https://www.facebook.com/EFGuz) if you have more questions about my process!
Great job ! I particularly like the hair :) All the glowing is cool too especially in the dark !
Very good! So creative I could never do this. 10 out of 10. Out of this world. :O Best Ekko cosplay NA.
